text:

The stock was sold at an average price of $32.66, for a total value of $416,153.72. Following the transaction, the insider now directly owns 72,647 shares in the company, valued at $2,372,651.02. The trade was a 14.92 % decrease in their ownership of the stock. The sale was disclosed in a document filed with the SEC, which is accessible through this link .

About Avidity Biosciences ( Get Free Report )
Avidity Biosciences, Inc, a biopharmaceutical company, engages in the delivery of RNA therapeutics. It develops antibody oligonucleotide conjugates (AOC) that are designed to treat diseases previously untreatable with RNA therapeutics. The company's lead product candidate AOC 1001 for the treatment of myotonic dystrophy type 1, a rare monogenic muscle disease that is in phase 1/2 clinical trial. author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text: A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her. The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected. According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement. Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up. “It is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,” wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit. Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment. "[Wilson’s] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,” he said in his report. “Trying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.” Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says. The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg. “Any negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote. Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem’s “negligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages. Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.

author: , Canton Repository
title: Lake runner Daniela Scheffler chosen Gatorade Ohio Player of the Year
text:
Lake's Daniela Scheffler named Gatorade Ohio Girls Cross Country Player of the Year Mike Popovich Canton Repository Another top honor is heading Daniela Scheffler's way.
The Lake High School senior has been named the 2024-25 Gatordade Ohio Girls Cross Country Player of the Year. The Gatorade Player of the Year celebrates the nation's best high school athletes for their success on the field, in the classroom and in the community. It recognizes Scheffler as Ohio’s best high school girls cross country athlete.
Scheffler won her first OHSAA Division I state championship in a meet-record 17:01.29 last fall. She qualified for the Nike Cross Country Nationals and finished 10th to earn All-American honors . She won nine of her 11 races and finished unbeaten against Ohio competition during the 2024 season.
A North Carolina State University signee, Scheffler has a 4.5 grade point average. She is a member of her school's Spanish club and has volunteered as a Sunday school mentor at her church. Through her 4-H involvement, she has excelled in agriculture and animal care and earned several local and state honors. She ia also a member of the North Canton Gymnastics team and Lake's team.
Reach Mike at mike.popovich@cantonrep.com
On X: @mpopovichREP

author: Redacción AN / KC
title: Detienen a encargado de ‘notificar’ extorsiones a polleros en Toluca
text:
Detienen a encargado de ‘notificar’ extorsiones a polleros en Toluca
La Secretaría de Seguridad del Estado de México informó que este jueves fue detenido un hombre señalado como responsable de enviar mensajes de extorsión a comerciantes de pollo en Toluca.
- Redacción AN / KC
La Secretaría de Seguridad (SS) del Estado de México informó sobre la detención de una persona, presuntamente relacionada con la extorsión a comerciantes de pollo en Toluca.
El sospechoso también está ligado al grupo delictivo “La Familia Michoacana”, al que se atribuye el secuestro de los cuatros polleros registrado la semana pasada.
“Tras la implementación de trabajos de inteligencia, personal de la Estatal Edomex y de la Policía Municipal de Toluca, detuvieron a un individuo posiblemente implicado en el delito de extorsión, en agravio de un comerciante de pollo.“, indicó la Secretaría en redes sociales.
Además, refirió que el detenido, aparentemente “pertenece a una célula del grupo delictivo con orígenes en Michoacán y cuya función era hacer llegar mensajes intimidatorios a los comerciantes para que paguen una cuota”.
De esta forma, los comerciantes y trabajadores de pollerías eran avisados o “notificados” de las extorsiones.
El hombre fue identificado como Jesús “N”, de 24 años de edad, y fue asegurado luego de que comerciantes de pollo lo mantuvieran retenido, tras intentar extorsionar a uno de ellos, en la Colonia Lomas Altas.
La víctima señaló que Jesús “N” Le entregó un mensaje en el que le exigía el pago de una cuota, que aparentemente los comerciantes de pollos daban de modo mensual a la célula criminal referida.
Las primeras investigaciones refieren que presuntamente, el detenido, dentro del grupo criminal, es el encargado de difundir los mensajes y dar aviso a las víctimas.
Te puede interesar >
Cae sujeto por secuestro de polleros en Toluca
También se pudo conocer que por cada kilo vendido, los extorsionadores piden 2 pesos a los comerciantes, con lo que la cifra podría ser millonaria cada mes.
Hasta el momento la dependencia no ha dado a conocer si esta persona se relaciona con el plagio de cuatro personas, trabajadores de una procesadora de pollo crudo, en Toluca.
Sin embargo, el 23 de diciembre, la policía del Estado de México reportó la detención de Santiago “N”, presuntamente vinculado con el plagio de cuatro trabajadores de una bodega en la que se procesaba pollo crudo.
A este sujeto también se le relaciona con el cartel de “La Familia Michoacana” y se le señala por ser el encargado de realizar los llamados “cobros de piso” y presuntamente participó en el secuestro de las cuatro personas.

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: The digital currency platform Enet Crypto Center Limited has gained favor among global users, featuring a unique user fund security system. | User | times-online.com
text: On December 20th, in a social media user-initiated poll for technology exchanges, Enet Crypto Center Limited (hereinafter referred to as Enet) won the favor of the majority of users. It ranked at the forefront in this event, thanks to its security and compliance. This indicates that Enet has allowed global users to experience secure and reliable digital asset trading services. It has gradually gained recognition in the market and has bolstered confidence in the platform to drive a more stable, secure, and reliable blockchain transaction system. Trust is a scarce factor in current information transmission, a necessary element in building a digital mirror world, and the cornerstone of achieving real and credible digital transformation. Therefore, Enet prioritizes user fund security. Its independently developed system kernel-level security adopts an advanced multi-layer, multi-cluster system architecture. It integrates advanced technologies such as sharded storage and DAG technology into the multi-layered architecture of the exchange, significantly enhancing the system's security, stability, and scalability. In terms of security, Enet has made more than one attempt. It is fully qualified, based on blockchain smart contract security. By empowering the financial field through blockchain, it comprehensively and multi-dimensionally ensures asset security. With strong R&D capabilities, anti-risk pricing mechanisms, risk reserve funds, and tiered reduction mechanisms, it achieves bank-level security risk control. Its goal is to ensure the protection of user data privacy, covering the entire data protection and governance system, and reducing transaction costs and risks. Enet is well aware that technology needs continuous promotion by talents. The platform has gathered a group of encryption experts and security teams, with over hundreds of security personnel. They conduct in-depth market research, analysis, investment, and incubation in the encryption industry, study the latest hacker attack methods, and help establish a fair power structure in the Web3.0 system, placing security and privacy at the core of the system. Enet meets the long-term investment and trading needs of users. It has always adhered to the development concept of "security" and "compliance." The platform equipment is high-performance servers selected through screening. Its risk management includes extensive order systems and trading tools for users. It provides the industry with relatively standardized solutions, also hoping to promote the industry's compliance and mainstreaming with its actions. Enet builds a secure platform for investors at the most fundamental level, creating a unique compliance barrier that allows users to fully control their digital assets. This is why Enet can better cope with various uncertainties in the industry and maintain a leading position in the market. Enet also plans to increase efforts to protect asset security and shield global digital trade investments. author: Sean Mitchell
title: Adobe unveils AI tools to enhance Premiere Pro editing
text:
Adobe has launched Generative Extend in Premiere Pro and announced AI-powered Media Intelligence to enhance video editing capabilities.
Generative Extend, utilising the Firefly Video Model, allows editors to extend both video and audio clips in 4K and vertical formats, addressing a common issue of incomplete clips and creating seamless transitions. "We're so excited to see how the Premiere Pro community uses Generative Extend in 4K and AI-powered Media Intelligence to create stories that capture our imaginations," said Ashley Still, Senior Vice President and General Manager of Digital Media at Adobe.
The Media Intelligence feature enables editors to swiftly locate specific clips within vast amounts of footage, changing the conventional method of manual searching. "I'm really excited by the AI products that Adobe is developing for filmmakers — especially new features like Media Intelligence, which helps me get to the edit that much faster," remarked Ernie Gilbert, filmmaker and editor of "Opus".
Alongside these updates, Adobe introduced AI-powered Caption Translation, allowing captions to be localised in 27 languages, and improvements in Premiere Pro's Colour Management, which facilitates enhanced high dynamic range and standard dynamic range adjustments.
The advancements in Adobe's After Effects software include enhanced performance for preview playback, advanced 3D motion design tools, and HDR monitoring. Justin Barnes, Executive Creative Director at Versus Creative Studio, commented on the impact of these tools: "Adobe's new Firefly-powered video tools like Generative Extend have been transformative for our creative and post-production workflows."
Frame.io V4 also sees significant upgrades with expanded storage capabilities designed to support large creative teams, improving collaboration by allowing extensive media to be managed within a single platform. The inclusion of transcription tools, watermarking, and enhanced access control features further streamline the content creation process.
The system becomes more efficient by offering editors automatic clip recognition based on content such as objects and locations, facilitating quicker access to required footage. Experts in the field recognise how these technological improvements can boost productivity by reducing time spent on mundane tasks.
Adobe's tools continue to be popular among filmmakers. Recent blockbusters such as "Anora" and television series "The Jinx — Part Two" used Adobe Creative Cloud tools in their production processes. Sean Baker, writer, director, and editor of "Anora," described Adobe Premiere Pro as a versatile tool ideal for both quick edits and complex sequences.

author: The Canadian Press
title: Homan downs Einarson 6-2 to remain undefeated at Grand Slam of Curling's WFG Masters
text:
GUELPH, Ont. - Rachel Homan remained undefeated at the Grand Slam of Curling’s WFG Masters with a 6-2 win over Kerri Einarson on Thursday.
Homan’s top-ranked team from Ottawa took control of the marquee matchup with two points in the fourth end to take a 4-1 lead.
